item.title: Car parked illegally (DN19HYV) in Sydenham Hill (Southbound), 4th December
item.description:
Please can the council send enforcement officers to reprimand/hold the owner of DN19HYV to account. This car has been parked on the double yellow stretch for 2 days now and is/has caused extreme backlogs on this road + London Road. How it is still there beggars belief and common sense!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Hill, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole/drain cover is loose and rocking, 4th December
item.description:
Manhole/drain cover is loose and rocking. It is so loud every time a vehicle drives over it, to a point where it is waking us and our neighbours up. Additional the crumbling ashpalt is posing a risk cyclist along a pretty busy cycling route. Have already seen 2 near misses of cyclists hitting the pothole and loosing balance. I have reported this a few times now. Hoping something can finally be done about it. Exact location: Out the front of 493 Kingsland Road, Dalston, E84AU.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 491-493, Kingsland Road, Dalston, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside block of flats on Ingestre Road (not Ongestre Estate), 4th December
item.description:
As per original report no 8500058. Leaves from the road and the pavement have not been cleared this autumn at all. Veolia only cleans the main roads e.g. Lady Somerset, Burghley Rd. it IS the Councils responsibility so please resolve. There has been a visible decline in street cleaning in the NW5 area (including dog waste not being cleaned) since Veolia has got their 8 years contract extension last summer. Council and Veolia need to sort it out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burghley Road, Tufnell Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public footpath in the gardens, 4th December
item.description:
We currently have contractors repairing the damaged footpaths in the gardens , but when I spoke to the workman this morning , he said he’s not doing them all ! Even though he agrees they are as bad as the ones he’s been tasked with ! I am one of the team of volunteers that maintains the gardens , we see lots of walking groups and elderly walking round the gardens and many have commented how bad and uneven they are , lots of trip hazards ! I’ve attached pics of the pathways not being done ! Please can this be reviewed as a matter of health and safety !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog mess and fly tipping, 4th December
item.description:
At the top of Penderry Rise, SE6 London, next to Bellingham/Hazlebank road there's a massive problem with people leaving dog mess in bags and without bags. Its close to Torridon primary school and hundreds of children make the journeys each morning and after school using this road. Its a big health and safety concern. We need a sign similar to the attached to warn people off leaving dog mess, clothes and furniture there. ​The dumping has become a daily occurrence and is seriously impacting the amenity and hygiene of our neighbourhood. The types of waste being consistently dumped include: ​Large Items: Furniture (sofas, mattresses), large cardboard boxes, and household waste. ​Contaminants: Numerous bags of dog foul, discarded clothing, and perishable household rubbish. ​This situation poses a significant public health hazard due to the presence of decaying waste and human/animal contaminants, and it is highly unsightly, creating an unacceptable environment for residents and particularly for the young children who must walk past it to and from school. Lewisham Council please help. From a concerned resident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penderry Rise, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate support pier & wall - deteriorated pointing, 4th December
item.description:
The brick wall and pier supporting the metal gate at the Church Road entrance to Bexleyheath Cemetery has eroded pointing which is quite extensive in area affected and in depth. Intervention now to repoint the brick courses will avert the damage worsening and resulting in a wall collapse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Church Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
